text: Arbignieu is a former commune in the Ain department in the Auvergne-Rhône- Alpes region of eastern France. On 1 January 2016, it was merged into the new commune Arboys-en-Bugey.Arrêté préfectoral 29 September 2015 471 people lived in the commune. The inhabitants are the Arbignolans. The local economy is mostly based around agriculture and wine. The most important monuments in the commune are the Boule de Gargantua, a block of sandstone moved there by the giant Gargantua (referring to the main character from the novel Gargantua by François Rabelais), the Peyzieu church and the ruins of the Château de Longecombe, a castle from the 12th century. Famous people from Arbignieu include Césaire Nivière, an agronomist from the 19th century. ==References== Category:Former communes in Ain Category:2016 disestablishments in France
title: Arbignieu
